channel.title: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape
channel.description: I'm trying to use a hacked client to connect to real runescape. I've downloaded the latest deob, but I get stuck at the verry first part of the loading thing. I have done alot of research, but found nothing that'd answer my question. So, has anyone got a tutorial or something on this?

item.title: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

The Un-Named:

There where SOME :: commands, and people added others such as ::filteroff but jagex caught on and started flagging accounts that did that, if I recall. Back in Kaitnieks days.

There still are a very small amount of those likke the ::cordpf I saw in a new deob

Read full topic
item.source: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape

item.title: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“ack, post:8, topic:134979”]Are you guys talking about when you get the source files off of one of the runescape servers?

for ex. A class
b class
bbclass
dclass
ieclass
loaderclass
peclass
unpackclass

I got the loader source files too if thats what you are talking about.

With the source files you can make undectable bots, password crackers, exploits, all sorts of stuff no ones thought of yet, and yes clients that you can use for hacking.

I wonder if i can get the :: jagex staff mod commands[/quote]

I don’t think you know much of what your talking about. You certainly can’t make an undetectable bot with just a deob.

Read full topic
item.source: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape

item.description:
@ack wrote:

Are you guys talking about when you get the source files off of one of the runescape servers?

for ex. A class
b class
bbclass
dclass
ieclass
loaderclass
peclass
unpackclass

I got the loader source files too if thats what you are talking about.

With the source files you can make undectable bots, password crackers, exploits, all sorts of stuff no ones thought of yet, and yes clients that you can use for hacking.

I wonder if i can get the :: jagex staff mod commands

item.title: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Yeah you can’t just change the Java files, you have to recompile even if you change something very small. Unfortunately the .class files don’t just update themselves automatically.

If you want the server prefixes easily just use FAWG found at Freddy1990.com, his world list generator retrieves all the addresses (they do sometimes change).

Read full topic
item.source: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape

item.title: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @tomz tomz
item.description:
@tomz wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:5, topic:134979”]how about just changing it to ams6.runescape.com?

jeez…[/quote]
It’s not like I didn’t try that… It’s just stuck at the connecting to update server part.

Edit: Just found ams6 didn’t exist, but changing to ams4 wouldn’t work either.

Edit2: It worked better when I compiled the code with the changed server! Thank you, sorry for being noobish

Read full topic

item.title: Making an edited client connect to RuneScape
item.dc:creator: @tomz tomz
item.description:
@tomz wrote:

shangtsung1:

search for 127.0.0.1 then change it too the RS ip

Thanks for the quick reply!

And this magic ip, is what you get from the ping command, for example ping ams6.runescape.com, isn’t it?

Didn’t work for me btw.

Read full topic
